DOC.detailed_description: The specific aim pilot study use group office visit model provide obesity treatment intervention child 8-11 year age gender-specific group parent clinic setting . The targeted lifestyle component intervention less TV viewing , less sweetened beverage , small food portion , less fast food/better choice away home general physical activity . The psychosocial component base Resiliency ; Choices model focused non-judgmental approach empowerment relation personal goal knowledge basic nutrition physical activity . Our aim recruit 35-40 child ( approximately equal boy girl ) age 8-11 parent 12 weekly session group office visit program . Participants randomize 2 group ; one group start March 2006 lag intervention control group start September 2006 . Physical measurement data collection baseline , 4 , 8 , 12 , 16 month randomization . We evaluate acceptability feasibility group office visit model effect size ( body mass index ( BMI ) weight-for-age Z-scores ) . Feasibility acceptability include ability recruit within clinic , attendance , completion , follow-up rate , focus group data interview drop . Evaluation effect size include pattern growth 15 month baseline relation expect growth pattern intervention exposure .
